required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Improved PAD Regimen In Multiple Myeloma
clinical_study.official_title: Study of Subcutaneous Versus Intravenous Administration of Bortezomib in Patients With Multiple Myeloma in China

lead_sponsor.agency: The First Affiliated Hospital of Soochow University

clinical_study.source: The First Affiliated Hospital of Soochow University

brief_summary.textblock: Intravenous injection is the standard administration route of bortezomib; however, subcutaneous administration is an important alternative. We want to compared the effi cacy and safety of subcutaneous versus intravenous bortezomib at the approved 1â€¢3 mg/m2 dose and twice per week,on days1, 4, 8 and 11 of 21-day cycles, schedule in patients with multiple myeloma. At the same time we adjust the dose of dexamethasone at 10mg and twice everyday, on days 1, 2, 4, 5, 8, 9, 11 and 12.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
clinical_study.condition: Multiple Myeloma Proved by Laboratory Tests

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Must be Multiple Myeloma Proved by Laboratory Tests
- Must have the ability to observe the efficacy and events
- Patient must have the ability to understand and willingness to provide written informed consent in the study and any related procedures being performed
Exclusion Criteria:
- If have uncontrolled intercurrent illness including ongoing or active infection,heart failure,unstable angina pectoris,or psychiatric illness/social situations that study requirements
- If have severe side-effects on bortezomib
